Sentence: I love to write about them , but I 'd hate to own one , since most of their market value comes from the market 's assumption that the company 's leaders will somehow find a way to retroactively justify their overvaluation .

extent: The recent rumors about WalMart's plans to buy out a shipping company have given rise to the fear that the company may go the conglomerate route
Sentence: The recent rumors about WalMart 's plans to buy out a shipping company have given rise to the fear that the company may go the conglomerate route .

extent: They have many of the symptoms of a late-stage conglomerate: A gigantic main business with slowing growth, fear that competition will substantially reduce the profitability of their main business, a shareholder base that includes many people who own only WalMart stock (thus providing another incentive for intracompany diversification), and enough resources to pull it off on a grand scale
Sentence: They have many of the symptoms of a late-stage conglomerate : A gigantic main business with slowing growth , fear that competition will substantially reduce the profitability of their main business , a shareholder base that includes many people who own only WalMart stock ( thus providing another incentive for intracompany diversification ) , and enough resources to pull it off on a grand scale .

extent: They're coming close to Smithfield Food's very successful 'squeal to meal' policy; if these rumors are true, the result for shareholders will be a pretty positive one
Sentence: They 're coming close to Smithfield Food 's very successful ' squeal to meal ' policy ; if these rumors are true , the result for shareholders will be a pretty positive one .
